reg_info.act_under: Land Titles Act   Loi sur l’enregistrement des droits immobiliers

content.content: 1. In this Regulation, “electronic format” means an electronic format within the meaning of section 17 of the Land Registration Reform Act; “non-electronic format” means a format that is not an electronic format within the meaning of section 17 of the Land Registration Reform Act and includes a written form. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 1.
content.raw_html:
1. In this Regulation,

“electronic format” means an electronic format within the meaning of section 17 of the Land Registration Reform Act;

“non-electronic format” means a format that is not an electronic format within the meaning of section 17 of the Land Registration Reform Act and includes a written form. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 1.

content.content: 2. An application under subsection 38 (6) of the Act shall be in Form 51 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 2.
content.raw_html: 2. An application under subsection 38 (6) of the Act shall be in Form 51 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 2.

content.content: 3. (1) An application for the registration of a caution against first registration under subsection 43 (1) of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 9 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 3 (1). (2) A withdrawal of a caution against first registration that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 11 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 3 (2).
content.raw_html:
3. (1) An application for the registration of a caution against first registration under subsection 43 (1) of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 9 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 3 (1).

(2) A withdrawal of a caution against first registration that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 11 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 3 (2).

content.content: 4. An application to amend the register under subsection 69 (1) or section 75 of the Act or under any other section of the Act under which no form is prescribed that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 15 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 4.
content.raw_html: 4. An application to amend the register under subsection 69 (1) or section 75 of the Act or under any other section of the Act under which no form is prescribed that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 15 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 4.

content.content: 5. An application to register a notice under section 71 of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 16 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990 or a form approved by the Director of Titles. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 5.
content.raw_html: 5. An application to register a notice under section 71 of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 16 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990 or a form approved by the Director of Titles. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 5.

content.content: 6. A transfer of charge under subsection 101 (1) or (6) of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 25 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 6.
content.raw_html: 6. A transfer of charge under subsection 101 (1) or (6) of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 25 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 6.

content.content: 7. A postponement under subsection 78 (6) of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 26 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 7.
content.raw_html: 7. A postponement under subsection 78 (6) of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 26 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 7.

content.content: 8. If the registered owner of the land submits an application to register in a non-electronic format a cessation of a registered charge under subsection 102 (1) of the Act, the application shall be in Form 28 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 8.
content.raw_html: 8. If the registered owner of the land submits an application to register in a non-electronic format a cessation of a registered charge under subsection 102 (1) of the Act, the application shall be in Form 28 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 8.

content.content: 9. Subject to section 82 of the Act, a discharge to which subsection 103 (1) of the Act applies shall be in the form that the Director of Titles approves. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 9.
content.raw_html: 9. Subject to section 82 of the Act, a discharge to which subsection 103 (1) of the Act applies shall be in the form that the Director of Titles approves. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 9.

content.content: 10. (1) A transfer of land by a chargee under section 99 of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 30 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 10 (1). (2) The evidence required by the Director of Titles under subsection 99 (1) of the Act shall be attached to the original transfer. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 10 (2). (3) This section applies with necessary modifications to, (a) a sale under a mortgage that was entered on the register on the first registration of the land; and (b) a charge in the form of a debenture or similar instrument. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 10 (3).
content.raw_html:
10. (1) A transfer of land by a chargee under section 99 of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 30 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 10 (1).

(2) The evidence required by the Director of Titles under subsection 99 (1) of the Act shall be attached to the original transfer. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 10 (2).

(3) This section applies with necessary modifications to,

(a) a sale under a mortgage that was entered on the register on the first registration of the land; and

(b) a charge in the form of a debenture or similar instrument. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 10 (3).

content.content: 11. (1) An application for a notice of a lease or for a notice of an agreement for a lease that is submitted for registration under subsection 111 (1) of the Act in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 31 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 11 (1). (2) A notice of an interest in a lease under subsection 111 (6) of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 32 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 11 (2).
content.raw_html:
11. (1) An application for a notice of a lease or for a notice of an agreement for a lease that is submitted for registration under subsection 111 (1) of the Act in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 31 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 11 (1).

(2) A notice of an interest in a lease under subsection 111 (6) of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 32 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 11 (2).

content.content: 12. (1) An application to register a caution that is submitted for registration under subsection 128 (1) or (2) of the Act in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 33 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 12 (1). (2) The affidavit required by section 131 of the Act shall be in Form 34 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 12 (2). (3) An application to renew a caution registered under section 128 of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 35 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 12 (3).
content.raw_html:
12. (1) An application to register a caution that is submitted for registration under subsection 128 (1) or (2) of the Act in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 33 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 12 (1).

(2) The affidavit required by section 131 of the Act shall be in Form 34 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 12 (2).

(3) An application to renew a caution registered under section 128 of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 35 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 12 (3).

content.content: 13. A withdrawal of a caution that is submitted for registration under subsection 129 (7) of the Act in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 37 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 13.
content.raw_html: 13. A withdrawal of a caution that is submitted for registration under subsection 129 (7) of the Act in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 37 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 13.

content.content: 14. A transmission application under section 120, 121, 122 or 127 of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in, (a) Form 40 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990, if made by an executor, administrator or estate trustee; or (b) Form 41 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990, if made by a devisee or heir at law. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 14.
content.raw_html:
14. A transmission application under section 120, 121, 122 or 127 of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in,

(a) Form 40 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990, if made by an executor, administrator or estate trustee; or

(b) Form 41 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990, if made by a devisee or heir at law. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 14.

content.content: 15. A survivorship application under section 123 of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 42 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 15.
content.raw_html: 15. A survivorship application under section 123 of the Act that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 42 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 15.

content.content: 16. An application under section 118 or 119 of the Act to impose on or annex to land a condition, restriction or covenant that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 46 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 16.
content.raw_html: 16. An application under section 118 or 119 of the Act to impose on or annex to land a condition, restriction or covenant that is submitted for registration in a non-electronic format shall be in Form 46 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 16.

content.content: 17. A certificate of withdrawal under subsection 171 (2) of the Act shall be in Form 50 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990 if the subject land is not situated in a land titles division where documents may be submitted for registration in an electronic format. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 17.
content.raw_html: 17. A certificate of withdrawal under subsection 171 (2) of the Act shall be in Form 50 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990 if the subject land is not situated in a land titles division where documents may be submitted for registration in an electronic format. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 17.

content.content: 18. A notice of a change of address for service under subsection 168 (2) of the Act that is submitted for registration in non-electronic format shall be in Form 52 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 18.
content.raw_html: 18. A notice of a change of address for service under subsection 168 (2) of the Act that is submitted for registration in non-electronic format shall be in Form 52 of Regulation 690 of the Revised Regulations of Ontario, 1990. O. Reg. 27/99, s. 18.
